original_title: All I Want for Mr. Christmas Is Some New Music
original_content:
You, its true; you really can find anything (except maybe LEGO) in thrift stores. When [thecowgoesmoo] picked up a Mr. Christmas Symphonium music box one day, they knew they wanted to make it play more than just the standard Christmas and classical fare that ships with the thing.
So they did what any self-respecting hacker would do, and they wrote a MATLAB script that generates new disk silhouette images that they then cut from cardboard with a laser cutter. They also used various other materials like a disposable cutting mat. Really, whatever is lying around thats stiff enough and able to be cut should work. You know you want to hear Van Halens Jump coming from a tinkling music box, dont you? Be sure to check out the video demonstration after the break.
If you dont want to wait around until a Mr. Christmas lands in your lap, why not make your own hand-cranked music box and accompanying scores?
title: スリフトストアで見つけたミュージックボックスを改造して、自由な曲を演奏する方法
body:
ある人が thrift store で Mr. Christmas Symphonium music box を見つけ、それには付属のクリスマスやクラシックの曲だけでなく他の曲も再生させるために、MATLAB スクリプトを作成し、物体をレーザーカッターで切った。手動で再生可能な音楽ボックスも作成できる。

Translation: thrift store で見つけた音楽ボックスを改造して、どんな曲でも再生できるようにしました。手動で再生可能な音楽ボックスも作成できます。
